verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Well, come sit ye down, and I'll tell you a tale It concerns what goes on 'tween lads and lasses 'Tis a good thing to learn for any canny lass And when I am done you will thank me.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Red is yer nose as on yer face it grows And red is me face as I sit here And red is the hand does the spankin' in this land But my arse is redder than any!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: "Now come to the bed, me bonnie little wife, And we'll have a bit of slap-and-tickle. And willing I went and well was I served But 'twas then that I made my great blunder.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "Oh, Johnnie, my love, your lovin' has no peer" And truer words were never spoken But Robbie's the name of my duly wedded lord And John is the name of my lover.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Then up from the bed, me husband bolted up And great was his rage as he shouted, "Now how is it, wife that ye call another's name, When I should be all that ye think of?"

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: My tale now is done, as I shift from cheek to cheek The lesson I learned is quite simple; If ye canna hold your tongue when ye're lyin' with a man, 'Tis best ye remain ever faithful!
